Get memed faggots.

To everyone shitting on historical (as opposed to phonetic) spelling in English: Historical spelling has several advantages over phonetic spelling. Both have their good points, but people like to be contrary and ignore that historical spelling unifies Anglophones with different accents in a single writing system, allows one to more easily trace the origin of a word and its meaning while reading, and makes it possible to read writing from long ago without having to learn another spelling regime. Plus you can distinguish through and threw without context.
